publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5672 Richard Lochhead: Royal National Lifeboat Institution—That the Parliament pays tribute to the Royal National Lifeboat Institution (RNLI) which in 2006 rescued over 1,000 people for the first time in its 184-year history; notes that 1,049 people were rescued by the brave crews in Buckie and across Scotland; further notes that, as a charity, the RNLI relies on donations of time and money to carry out its vital role, and commends RNLI staff and crew who protect seafarers and those using Scotland’s seas.
S2M-5672 Royal National Lifeboat Institution (lodged on 28 February 2007) Stewart Stevenson*, Mr David Davidson*, Ms Sandra White*

S2M-5672 Richard Lochhead: Royal National Lifeboat Institution—That the Parliament pays tribute to the Royal National Lifeboat Institution (RNLI) which in 2006 rescued over 1,000 people for the first time in its 184-year history; notes that 1,049 people were rescued by the brave crews in Buckie and across Scotland; further notes that, as a charity, the RNLI relies on donations of time and money to carry out its vital role, and commends RNLI staff and crew who protect seafarers and those using Scotland’s seas. Supported by: Stewart Stevenson, Mr David Davidson, Ms Sandra White

S2M-5672 Royal National Lifeboat Institution (lodged on 28 February 2007) Campbell Martin*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Jim Mather*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Fergus Ewing*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Mr John Swinney*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Robin Harper*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Alex Johnstone*, Rob Gibson*, Eleanor Scott*, Shiona Baird*, Frances Curran*, Fiona Hyslop*, Rosie Kane*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Christine Grahame*, Alex Neil*

S2M-5672 Royal National Lifeboat Institution (lodged on 28 February 2007) Mrs Nanette Milne*, John Swinburne*, Derek Brownlee*, Brian Adam*, Phil Gallie*, Michael Matheson*, Donald Gorrie*, Ms Maureen Watt*
S2M-5672 Royal National Lifeboat Institution (lodged on 28 February 2007) Iain Smith*, Dr Jean Turner*, Chris Ballance*
S2M-5672 Royal National Lifeboat Institution (lodged on 28 February 2007) Linda Fabiani*
S2M-5672 Royal National Lifeboat Institution (lodged on 28 February 2007) Mr Jim Wallace*

S2M-5672 Richard Lochhead: Royal National Lifeboat Institution—That the Parliament pays tribute to the Royal National Lifeboat Institution (RNLI) which in 2006 rescued over 1,000 people for the first time in its 184-year history; notes that 1,049 people were rescued by the brave crews in Buckie and across Scotland; further notes that, as a charity, the RNLI relies on donations of time and money to carry out its vital role, and commends RNLI staff and crew who protect seafarers and those using Scotland’s seas. Supported by: Stewart Stevenson, Mr David Davidson, Ms Sandra White, Campbell Martin, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Jim Mather, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Fergus Ewing, Mr Jamie Stone, Mr John Swinney, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Robin Harper, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Alex Johnstone, Rob Gibson, Eleanor Scott, Shiona Baird, Frances Curran, Fiona Hyslop, Rosie Kane, Mr Adam Ingram, Christine Grahame, Alex Neil, Mrs Nanette Milne, John Swinburne, Derek Brownlee, Brian Adam, Phil Gallie, Michael Matheson, Donald Gorrie, Ms Maureen Watt, Iain Smith, Dr Jean Turner, Chris Ballance, Linda Fabiani, Mr Jim Wallace
